# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= " $word"
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = " $word"
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
words = ["Here", "is", "a", "long", "sentence", "that",
           "we", "will", "use", "to", "test", "our", "wrap_string"]
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output a wrapped text with each line not exceeding the `text_width` of 10 characters.
